list.description: Disable automatic syncing (optional, for cleanup or testing)

list.title: module:JellyfinUserSettings.enableAutoSync
list.description: Enable automatic syncing of settings changes to registry Call this AFTER loading initial settings from registry/server This starts field observers that write changes back to registry

list.title: module:JellyfinUserSettings.observeAllSettings
list.description: Dynamically set up observers for all user setting fields This automatically handles new fields added to the XML without code changes

list.title: module:JellyfinUserSettings.onDisplaySettingsChanged
list.description: Called when displaySettings field changes Only syncs the specific settings that changed, not the entire object

list.title: module:JellyfinUserSettings.onSettingChanged
list.description:
Called when any individual setting field changes Observer is the single source of truth for registry sync IMPORTANT: Only syncs to registry - does NOT modify the node (prevents recursion)

DESIGN: Always save settings to registry, never delete This preserves user intent - if user explicitly sets a value to match the default, that's different from "never touched this setting". This is important for:

  • Future multi-device sync
  • Understanding what users have customized
  • "Reset all settings" feature can delete entire registry section

list.title: module:Subtitles.availSubtitleTrackIdx
list.description: Roku translates the info provided in subtitleTracks into availableSubtitleTracks Including ignoring tracks, if they are not understood, thus making indexing unpredictable. This function translates between our internel selected subtitle index and the corresponding index in availableSubtitleTracks.

list.title: module:Subtitles.defaultSubtitleTrack
list.description: Identify the default subtitle track if "requires_text" is true, only return a track if it is textual This allows forcing text subs, since roku requires transcoding of non-text subs returns the server-side track index for the appriate subtitle

list.title: module:Subtitles.defaultSubtitleTrackFromVid
list.description: Identify the default subtitle track for a given video id returns the server-side track index for the appriate subtitle

list.title: module:Subtitles.getSubtitleSelIdxFromSubIdx
list.description: The subtitle index on the server differs from the index we track locally This function converts the former into the latter

list.title: module:Subtitles.selectSubtitleTrackDialog
list.description: Present Dialog to user to select subtitle track

list.title: module:Subtitles.setupSubtitle
list.description: Given a set of subtitles, and a subtitle index (the index on the server, not in the list provided) this will set all relevant settings for roku (mainly closed captions) and return the index of the subtitle track specified, but indexed based on the provided list of subtitles

list.title: module:Subtitles.sortSubtitles
list.description: Checks available subtitle tracks and puts subtitles in forced, default, and non-default/forced but preferred language at the top

list.title: module:displaySettings.deepCopyDisplaySettings
list.description: Deep copy displaySettings AA structure Creates a new AA reference with all nested library settings copied This ensures observer will detect changes when we reassign to the node field

list.title: module:displaySettings.deleteLibraryDisplaySettings
list.description: Delete all display settings for a library

list.title: module:displaySettings.getLibraryDisplaySetting
list.description: Get specific display setting for a library with fallback Returns: Setting value or defaultValue if not found The returned value will be type-cast to match the defaultValue's type

list.title: module:displaySettings.getLibraryDisplaySettings
list.description: Get all display settings for a library Returns: AA with all settings, or empty {} if library not found Example: { sortField: "DateCreated", filter: "Favorites", landing: "Movies" }

list.title: module:displaySettings.getLibraryDisplaySettingsBatch
list.description: Batch get multiple settings at once (performance optimization) keys: Array of setting keys ["sortField", "filter", "landing"] defaults: AA of default values { sortField: "SortName", filter: "All" } Returns: AA with all requested settings

list.title: module:displaySettings.setLibraryDisplaySetting
list.description: Set library display setting (updates node + persists to registry)

list.description: Save Constants

list.description: client version when settings were renamed from dotted names to camelCase

list.description: Run all necessary registry mirations on the "global" JellyRock registry section

list.title: module:misc.arrayHasValue
list.description: Check if a specific value is inside of an array

list.title: module:misc.findParentOfType
list.description: Traverses up the node hierarchy to find a parent node of a specific type This is useful for finding the main component when handling button events

list.title: module:misc.findParentWithField
list.description: Traverses up the node hierarchy to find a parent node that has a specific field This is useful for finding the main component when handling button events

list.title: module:misc.formatIsoDateVideo
list.description: convert iso date string to a human readable date string eg. "March 13th, 2014"

list.title: module:misc.formatTime
list.description: Format time as 12 or 24 hour format based on system clock setting NOTE: This is NOT used by app's clock, only for displaying time in dialogs

list.title: module:misc.getMinutes
list.description: Converts ticks to minutes

list.title: module:misc.get_dialog_result
list.description: Returns the item selected or -1 on backpress or other unhandled closure of dialog.

list.title: module:misc.inArray
list.description: Search string array for search value. Return if it's found

list.title: module:misc.inferServerUrl
list.description: take an incomplete url string and use it to make educated guesses about the complete url. then tests these guesses to see if it can find a jf server returns the url of the server it found, or an empty string

list.title: module:misc.isAllValid
list.description: Returns whether or not all items in passed array are valid

list.title: module:misc.isChainValid
list.description: isChainValid: Returns whether or not all the properties in the passed property chain are valid. Stops evaluating at first found false value

list.title: module:misc.isJellyfinServer
list.description: accepts the raw json string of /system/info/public and returns a boolean indicating if ProductName is "Jellyfin Server"

list.title: module:misc.isLocalhost
list.description: Returns true if the string is a loopback, such as 'localhost' or '127.0.0.1'

list.title: module:misc.isValid
list.description: Returns whether or not passed value is valid

list.title: module:misc.isValidAndNotEmpty
list.description: Returns whether or not passed value is valid and not empty Accepts a string, or any countable type (arrays and lists)

list.title: module:misc.parseUrl
list.description: Returns an array from a url = [ url, proto, host, port, subdir+params ] If port or subdir are not found, an empty string will be added to the array Proto must be declared or array will be empty

list.title: module:misc.roundNumber
list.description: Rounds number to nearest integer

list.title: module:misc.secondsToTimestamp
list.description: Converts seconds to a human readable timestamp. Used for progress bar during playback eg. 3661 seconds = "01:01:01"

list.title: module:misc.shuffleArray
list.description: Takes an array of data, shuffles the order, then returns the array uses the Fisher-Yates shuffling algorithm

list.title: module:misc.startLoadingSpinner
list.description: startLoadingSpinner: Start a loading spinner and attach it to the main JRScene. Displays an invisible ProgressDialog node by default to disable keypresses while loading.

list.title: module:misc.ticksToMinutes
list.description: Converts ticks to number of minutes eg. 3661 totalSeconds = 61

list.title: module:misc.toBoolean
list.description: convert value to boolean and return value

list.title: module:misc.urlCandidates
list.description: this is the "educated guess" logic for inferServerUrl that generates a list of complete url's as candidates for the tests in inferServerUrl. takes an incomplete url as an arg and returns a list of extrapolated full urls.

list.title: module:misc.versionChecker
list.description: Returns whether or not a version number (e.g. 10.7.7) is greater or equal to some minimum version allowed (e.g. 10.8.0)

list.title: module:schedule.channelsearchTermSet
list.description: Voice Search set

list.description: Move the TV Guide Grid down or up depending whether details are selected

list.title: module:schedule.onChannelsLoaded
list.description: Initial list of channels loaded

list.title: module:schedule.onGridScrolled
list.description: As user scrolls grid, check if more data requries to be loaded

list.title: module:schedule.onProgramDetailsLoaded
list.description: Update the Program Details with full information

list.title: module:schedule.onRecordChannelSelected
list.description: Handle user selecting "Record Channel" from Program Details

list.title: module:schedule.onRecordSeriesChannelSelected

list.title: module:schedule.onWatchChannelSelected

list.title: module:settings.OnScreenHidden
list.description: JRScreen hook that gets ran as needed. Assumes settings were changed and they affect the device profile. Posts a new device profile to the server using the task thread

list.title: module:settings.isFormInFocus
list.description: Returns true if any of the data entry forms are in focus

list.title: module:settings.postFinished
list.description: Triggered by m.postTask after completing a post. Empty the task data when finished.

list.title: nodeUtils.populateNodeFromAA
list.description:
Populate a ContentNode from an associative array

Example: localServer = m.global.server mockData = MockDataLoader.LoadServer("default") nodeUtils.populateNodeFromAA(localServer, mockData, [])

IMPORTANT: When populating nodes on m.global, get a local reference first This minimizes rendezvous

list.title: nodeUtils.populateNodeFromNode
list.description:
Populate a ContentNode from another ContentNode's fields

Example: localServer = m.global.server transformedServer = transformer.transformServerInfo(mockData) nodeUtils.populateNodeFromNode(localServer, transformedServer, [])

IMPORTANT: When populating nodes on m.global, get a local reference first This minimizes rendezvous

list.title: nodeUtils.resetNodeToDefaults
list.description:
Reset a ContentNode to its XML-defined defaults

Example: localServer = m.global.server nodeUtils.resetNodeToDefaults(localServer, "JellyfinServer", [])

IMPORTANT: When resetting nodes on m.global, get a local reference first This minimizes rendezvous (only 1 rendezvous to get local ref, then 0 for reset)

list.title: quickplay
list.description: All of the Quick Play logic seperated by media type

list.title: quickplay.album
list.description: A music album. Play the entire album starting with track 1.

list.title: quickplay.artist
list.description: A music artist. Shuffle play all songs by artist.

list.title: quickplay.audio
list.description: A single audio file.

list.title: quickplay.boxset
list.description: A boxset. Play all items inside.

list.title: quickplay.collectionFolder
list.description: Quick Play A CollectionFolder. Shuffle play the items inside with some differences based on collectionType.

list.title: quickplay.folder
list.description: Quick Play A folder. Shuffle play all items found

list.title: quickplay.multipleSeries
list.description: More than one TV Show Series. Shuffle play all watched episodes

list.title: quickplay.musicVideo
list.description: A single music video file.

list.title: quickplay.person
list.description: Quick Play A Person. Shuffle play all videos found

list.title: quickplay.photo
list.description: A single photo.

list.title: quickplay.photoAlbum
list.description: A photo album.

list.title: quickplay.playlist
list.description: Quick Play A Playlist. Play the first unwatched episode. If none, play the whole season starting with episode 1.

list.title: quickplay.program
list.description: Quick Play A Live Program

list.title: quickplay.pushToQueue
list.description: Takes an array of items and adds to global queue. Also shuffles the playlist if asked

list.title: quickplay.season
list.description: A TV Show Season. Play the first unwatched episode. If none, play the whole season starting with episode 1.

list.title: quickplay.series
list.description: A TV Show Series. Play the first unwatched episode. If none, shuffle play the whole series.

list.title: quickplay.tvChannel
list.description: Quick Play A TVChannel

list.title: quickplay.userView
list.description: Quick Play A UserView. Play logic depends on "collectionType".

list.title: quickplay.video
list.description: A single video file.

list.title: quickplay.videoContainer
list.description: A container with some kind of videos inside of it
